implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any session management or authentication mechanisms, and therefore does not limit the number of concurrent sessions per user or entity.

statements.description: The system lacks any session management or authentication capabilities, resulting in no control or limitation on concurrent sessions. This gap exposes the system to risks related to unauthorized access and resource exhaustion.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any session management or user authentication, and therefore does not support automatic session termination. No session timeout or termination mechanism is present.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any form of session management or tracking. There are no implemented mechanisms to identify or terminate user sessions automatically after a period of inactivity or any other criteria. This absence constitutes a gap in meeting the AC-12 control requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms or session management, and therefore does not provide a user-initiated logout capability for authenticated sessions as required by the control.

statements.description: The service lacks any authentication or session management mechanisms, so no user-initiated logout functionality exists. This gap was identified through code and configuration reviews indicating no authentication, no session tracking, and no logout capabilities.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any session management or authentication mechanisms, and therefore does not display any explicit logout or termination messages to users upon termination of authenticated communication sessions.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented authentication or session management. Without authenticated sessions, there is no mechanism to display termination messages at logout. This represents a security gap with respect to control AC-12.2.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions. All communication, including TCP and HTTP, is transmitted without encryption, exposing sensitive data to interception and tampering.

statements.description: Review of TinyHTTP source code and configuration reveals no use of encryption protocols such as TLS for HTTP or TCP connections. No cryptographic libraries or mechanisms are implemented to secure remote sessions, leaving data vulnerable to interception and modification during transit.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system does not implement any authentication or identity management, and there is no mechanism to manage or enforce credential changes for shared or group accounts. No credential change processes or configurations exist to satisfy AC-2(10).

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms or identity management, resulting in no capability to change credentials for shared or group accounts. Credential management processes are not implemented, leaving this control unmet.

implemented-requirements.description: The system lacks any automated mechanisms to disable temporary and emergency accounts. There are no authentication or identity management features implemented, making this control applicable but currently representing a security gap.

statements.description: TinyHTTP service does not implement any identity or account management features, including temporary or emergency accounts, nor does it have automated account disablement configured.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any identity management or authentication mechanisms, and therefore does not manage user accounts or their expiration. There is no capability to disable expired accounts because no accounts exist or are managed by the system.

statements.description: The system does not implement identity or account management functions; no user accounts are created, managed, or expired. Consequently, there is no mechanism to disable accounts based on expiration, leaving this control unmet.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system does not implement any identity management or user account mechanisms; therefore, disabling accounts that are no longer associated with users is not addressed.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any form of user accounts or identity management. No authentication or authorization mechanisms exist, so there are no accounts to disable. This represents a gap in satisfying the control requirement.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication or identity management mechanisms, and therefore does not implement account disabling procedures. There are no account or user entities managed by the system, making it impossible to disable accounts as required by the control.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication or identity management system. Consequently, no user accounts exist within the system scope to be disabled when in violation of organizational policy. This lack constitutes a security gap relative to the control requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any identity or account management, including disabling inactive accounts. There is no mechanism to track account inactivity or disable accounts based on inactivity duration as required by the parameter ac-02.03_odp.02.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement user accounts, authentication, or identity management. Consequently, there is no process or configuration for disabling accounts that have been inactive for the specified time period. This represents a control gap that must be addressed by implementing an identity and access management solution with account lifecycle management.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement automated audit actions for account creation, modification, enabling, disabling, or removal, as no authentication or account management mechanisms exist in the system.

statements.description: The system lacks any form of authentication and identity management, and therefore does not generate audit records for account lifecycle events. Basic logging exists but does not cover user or account-related actions automatically.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented authentication or authorization mechanisms, resulting in no enforcement of approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources. There are no access control policies or identity management features currently implemented.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication or authorization controls. No access control policies are enforced, and there is no identity or session management. This absence results in a critical security gap allowing unauthorized access to system resources.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any discretionary access control mechanisms to restrict or manage information flow between subjects and objects, allowing unrestricted passing of information.

statements.description: The system lacks authentication and authorization enforcement, and no access control policies are implemented to restrict information passing between subjects or objects. This results in unrestricted data flow, violating the discretionary access control requirement.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable. The TinyHTTP service does not implement discretionary access control capabilities allowing subjects to grant privileges to other subjects. There is no authorization model or access control policy implemented, representing a gap in the system's security posture.

statements.description: The system lacks any discretionary access control mechanism. No subject can grant privileges to others as the service does not implement authentication or authorization policies. This gap increases the risk of unauthorized access and privilege escalation.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable and represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement discretionary access control mechanisms or allow changes to security attributes on subjects, objects, or system components. There is no authentication or authorization, and no configuration or code enforces access control policies or attribute changes.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implementation of discretionary access control. No mechanisms exist to change security attributes on subjects or objects. Authentication and authorization are absent, leaving the system vulnerable to unauthorized access without any controls to modify security attributes.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. TinyHTTP does not implement discretionary access control mechanisms to choose or enforce security attributes for newly created or revised objects. There is no configuration or code enforcing attribute-based access to resources.

statements.description: TinyHTTP lacks any implementation of discretionary access control. There are no mechanisms or configurations to assign or enforce security attributes on objects. This absence creates a significant security gap allowing unrestricted access to resources.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any discretionary access control mechanisms or rules governing access control. There is no authentication or authorization model in place, and no configuration exists to manage or change access control rules.

statements.description: The system lacks any discretionary access control implementation. No mechanisms are in place to control or change access permissions, and the source code and configuration do not provide any configurable access control rules.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system or between connected systems. There are no implemented authentication or authorization mechanisms, no encryption or secure communication channels, and no configurations to control or restrict information flow as required by the control.

statements.description: The system lacks any form of authentication and authorization, leaving information flow uncontrolled and unrestricted. No security policies or configurations exist to enforce approved authorizations for data transmission or access.
Data flows within the system and between components occur without encryption or flow control, exposing sensitive information to interception and unauthorized access.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication or authorization mechanisms to prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions, leaving the system vulnerable to unauthorized access and privilege escalation.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement access control or privilege separation. There are no mechanisms to verify user identity or restrict execution of privileged functions. This gap exposes the system to unauthorized operations by any user or client connecting to the service.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable and represents a security gap. The TinyHTTP service and its components do not enforce restrictions preventing software from executing at higher privilege levels than the user executing the software. No privilege level controls or mechanisms are implemented to limit code execution privileges, which increases risk of privilege escalation.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP codebase and associated modules lack any mechanism to prevent software from executing at elevated privilege levels beyond those of the invoking user. No privilege separation, sandboxing, or user privilege enforcement is implemented, leading to a gap in enforcing least privilege for code execution.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable. The system logs connection attempts and HTTP requests at basic levels, but does not explicitly log the execution of privileged functions, as no authentication or authorization is implemented to define privilege boundaries. Therefore, logging privileged function execution is not inherently supported and represents a gap.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service currently implements basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests; however, it lacks authentication and authorization mechanisms, thus does not define or log privileged function executions. Without privilege separation, logging execution of privileged functions is not feasible.
No configuration or code in TinyHTTP explicitly logs the execution of privileged functions. The gap exists due to absence of privilege definitions and related logging controls.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The system lacks any authentication mechanisms to identify users, and therefore does not enforce limits on consecutive invalid logon attempts or any related session controls.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement user authentication or logon mechanisms. Without user identities, the system cannot enforce any limits on invalid logon attempts or session lockouts. This represents a compliance gap with the AC-7smt.a control requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a security gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms or account lockout policies to automatically restrict access after a maximum number of unsuccessful logon attempts.

statements.description: The system does not implement authentication or logon attempt tracking. Consequently, it lacks automatic lockout or other mitigations triggered after exceeding unsuccessful logon attempts. No configuration or code enforces this control requirement.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any user authentication or session management, and therefore cannot notify users of previous logon dates and times. There is no functionality or configuration to support this control.

statements.description: No authentication or user identity management is implemented in any TinyHTTP components. Without user authentication, the system cannot track individual logon events or provide previous logon notifications to users. This represents a control gap that must be addressed for compliance.

implemented-requirements.description: Control AU-10 is applicable but represents a security gap. The TinyHTTP service provides no mechanisms to generate irrefutable evidence that an individual or process has performed auditable actions. There is no authentication, cryptographic assurance, or tamper-proof logging implemented to satisfy non-repudiation requirements.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks authentication, secure logging, and cryptographic measures required to provide irrefutable evidence of actions performed by individuals or processes. Audit logs do not ensure data integrity or non-repudiation. This gap increases the risk that actions cannot be conclusively attributed or repudiated.

implemented-requirements.description: The system provides basic audit record generation by logging connection attempts and HTTP requests as part of its operations. However, the logging is minimal and lacks structured audit records, integrity protections, filtering of sensitive information, and defined retention policies. Therefore, while the control is applicable, it is only partially satisfied through configuration and represents a gap in meeting comprehensive audit record generation requirements.

values: Basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests at INFO and DEBUG levels

statements.description: Audit records are generated for network connections and HTTP requests, providing a foundational capability for monitoring system events. These logs are produced by the asynchronous, threaded, and TCP server components.

Current logging lacks controls for audit record integrity, sensitive data filtering, and retention policies. No cryptographic protections or structured logging formats are implemented, representing a compliance gap against AU-2a event definitions and audit record generation best practices.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but only satisfied through configuration. The TinyHTTP service allows operators to select event types for audit logging via configuration parameters. Audit logs currently capture connection attempts and HTTP request details, but logging is basic and must be configured explicitly to specify which event types are logged by different system components.

statements.description: Audit logging is implemented in the system with configurable options to select event types such as connection attempts, HTTP requests, and error events. These settings are controlled via configuration parameters enabling operators to tailor logging to the system component and operational requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service implements only basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests without ensuring audit records are generated for all event types defined in AU-2c or including the detailed audit record content defined in AU-3. There is no guarantee of completeness, integrity, or sensitivity filtering of audit records.

statements.description: The current logging captures basic events such as connection attempts and HTTP status codes but lacks structured audit record generation for all required event categories or detailed audit content as defined by AU-2c and AU-3. There is no configuration or mechanism to ensure audit records meet compliance requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service implements only basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests, but does not compile audit records into a system-wide, time-correlated audit trail. There is no centralized audit logging mechanism that aggregates logs from different components to ensure time correlation within a specified threshold.

statements.description: Audit records are generated locally within components (e.g., HTTP server and TCP echo server) but are not aggregated into a system-wide audit trail. Logs lack synchronized timestamps and there is no mechanism to correlate logs across components within a defined time window. This gap prevents comprehensive audit analysis and timely detection of security events.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system does not automatically initiate session audits at system start-up, as no auditing or session tracking mechanisms are implemented in the TinyHTTP service.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any form of session management or auditing at system start-up. No configuration or code triggers the automatic initiation of auditing sessions when the system starts. Logging is minimal and does not include audit session initiation, resulting in non-compliance with control AU-14.1 requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system's audit records capture basic event types such as connection attempts and HTTP requests, but lack comprehensive detail on the specific type of event that occurred. There is no structured or consistent logging of event categories or types to satisfy the control requirements fully.

statements.description: Audit logging is limited to recording connection attempts and HTTP request summaries without categorizing or detailing the specific type of event. No secure or structured audit log format is implemented to identify event types explicitly.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The system logs basic events such as connection attempts and HTTP requests, but does not explicitly capture or ensure the timestamp of when the event occurred in audit records. There is no secure or structured logging mechanism that guarantees accurate event timestamps for compliance with this control.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service logs connection attempts and HTTP requests; however, these audit records lack detailed and guaranteed timestamps for each event occurrence. Logging is basic and does not include integrity or time synchronization features, which creates a gap in satisfying the control's requirement to record when events occurred.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system implements basic logging capturing connection attempts and HTTP requests; however, audit records do not reliably capture 'where the event occurred' with sufficient detail or integrity assurance.

statements.description: Audit logs capture connection attempts and HTTP requests but lack detailed context such as precise source locations or system components involved in the events. Logs do not include structured metadata to identify 'where the event occurred', which is necessary for comprehensive auditing and forensic analysis.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system's audit records lack explicit content indicating the source of the event. Logging is minimal and only captures basic connection attempts and HTTP requests without structured event source information or integrity protections.

statements.description: Audit logs capture connection attempts and HTTP requests but do not include explicit metadata identifying the source of each event. There is no assurance of log integrity or detailed event attribution, resulting in incomplete audit records regarding event sources.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. While basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests is present, the audit records do not consistently capture the outcome of events in a structured or comprehensive manner required by the control. There is no indication that the logs capture detailed event outcomes or ensure integrity and completeness of audit records.

statements.description: Audit logging captures connection attempts and HTTP status codes but lacks detail on the outcome of each event beyond basic success/failure indication. Logs are unstructured and do not ensure data integrity or comprehensive coverage of event outcomes.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system lacks authentication and identity management, and audit logs do not capture identities of individuals, subjects, or entities associated with events.

statements.description: Audit logs capture connection attempts and HTTP requests, but without authentication or identity management, the logs do not include the identity of individuals, subjects, or entities associated with events. This represents a compliance and security gap.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system generates basic audit records but does not include additional audit information as required. Audit logging is limited, lacks sensitive data filtering, and does not ensure data integrity or completeness of required audit details.

statements.description: Audit logging is implemented at a basic level, capturing connection attempts and HTTP requests with INFO or DEBUG level logs. However, the logs do not incorporate the additional audit information specified by the control parameter au-03.01_odp, such as detailed user actions, system events, or contextual data. There is no evidence of filtering sensitive information or ensuring audit record integrity.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system performs basic logging but does not transfer audit logs to an alternate storage, system component, or media, resulting in potential risk of log loss or tampering.

statements.description: Audit logs are generated locally capturing connection attempts and HTTP requests; however, there is no implemented mechanism or configuration to transfer these logs to alternate storage or separate systems, leaving audit trails vulnerable to loss or modification.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but only satisfied through configuration. The TinyHTTP service implements basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests but does not inherently generate alerts on audit logging process failures. Alerting is configured to notify the security team within 5 minutes of any audit logging failure, using external monitoring tools integrated with the service logs.

statements.description: Audit logging in TinyHTTP captures connection attempts and HTTP requests but lacks automatic alerting on failures. A monitoring configuration has been implemented to detect logging failures and generate alerts to the Security Operations Team within 5 minutes. This is accomplished via integration with external monitoring and alerting tools that watch log integrity and service operation.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable and satisfied only through configuration. The system uses basic logging to capture connection attempts and HTTP requests but lacks mechanisms to respond to audit logging process failures inherently. Configuration parameters defining actions on logging failures are set to ensure alerts and retries.

values: On audit logging failure, the system triggers immediate alerts to the security engineering team and initiates automated retries of the logging process within 5 seconds.

statements.description: Audit logging failures are detected via monitoring scripts that verify log file write success. Upon failure, alerts are sent via email and internal messaging to security engineers. Automated retry mechanisms attempt to restore audit logging within 5 seconds. This configuration is documented and maintained in the operational playbook.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system does not implement a centralized mechanism to review and analyze audit records from multiple components. Audit logging is basic and localized to individual components without aggregation or central analysis capabilities.

statements.description: Audit and logging are implemented only at the component level with basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests. There is no centralized log collection, aggregation, or analysis platform in place to provide a comprehensive view across the system components.

implemented-requirements.description: The system implements basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests but lacks advanced audit record reduction and report generation capabilities. Audit record review and analysis are not supported on-demand, and no formal reporting or after-the-fact incident investigation tools are provided, representing a gap in audit support.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service logs basic information such as connection attempts and HTTP status codes; however, it lacks structured audit record reduction, automated report generation, and formal support for after-the-fact investigations of incidents.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system performs basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP request status codes; however, it does not implement mechanisms to ensure that audit record reduction or report generation preserves the original content and time ordering of audit records.

statements.description: The logging implemented is minimal and does not include safeguards to prevent alteration of audit record content or time ordering during reduction or reporting. There is no evidence of processes or configurations that ensure audit integrity, creating a gap in compliance with this control requirement.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks the use of internal system clocks for generating reliable time stamps for audit records. Current logging is minimal, without assurance that time stamps are generated securely or consistently from internal clocks.

statements.description: Audit logging in the TinyHTTP service captures basic connection attempts and HTTP requests but does not explicitly use internal system clocks for time stamping. Logs lack structured, reliable time stamps tied to system clocks, which introduces a gap in audit record integrity and traceability.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service implements basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests; however, audit records do not include time stamps that meet the required specifications of using Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), having a fixed local time offset, or including the local time offset as part of the time stamp. There is no explicit configuration or code evidence that time stamps are recorded in the mandated manner for audit logs.

statements.description: Audit logging is implemented in a basic form, capturing connection attempts and HTTP requests with time stamps; however, the time stamps do not conform to the control requirement to use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) or include the local time offset. No configuration or code enforces use of UTC or time offset information in audit records.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service implements basic logging of connection attempts and requests but lacks protections to prevent unauthorized access, modification, or deletion of audit information and logging tools. No authentication, access controls, or integrity protections for audit logs are implemented.

statements.description: Audit logs capture basic connection and request events but do not implement access controls or integrity protections. Logs are stored without encryption or write-once mechanisms, and no role-based restrictions exist to prevent unauthorized log modification or deletion.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system lacks mechanisms to alert upon detection of unauthorized access, modification, or deletion of audit information, as no alerting or monitoring system is implemented.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service implements basic logging of connection attempts and HTTP requests but does not include alerting capabilities for unauthorized access or modifications of audit logs. No monitoring or alerting infrastructure is configured to detect or notify security personnel about audit information tampering.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable. Audit records are not stored on separate physical systems or components. The current implementation logs audit records locally on the same systems that perform the audited functions, which does not meet the control's requirement for physical separation.

statements.description: Audit logs are generated locally by the HTTP and TCP servers but are not forwarded or stored in a physically separate system or component. There is no configuration or implementation of a dedicated log server or physically isolated audit repository. This represents a gap in meeting the requirement to store audit records on separate physical systems or components.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity of audit information and audit tools. No encryption or cryptographic validation is implemented for logs or audit data, and audit tools are not secured cryptographically.

statements.description: Audit logging is implemented at a basic level (INFO/DEBUG logs) without any cryptographic protections such as digital signatures, HMACs, or encryption to ensure integrity and authenticity of audit data. There are no cryptographic safeguards for audit tools. This represents a compliance and security gap.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable. The system does not allow user installation of software without explicit privileged status. Software installation is restricted to users with administrative or root privileges, enforced by the underlying OS and deployment environment configurations.

values: Software installation requires administrative privileges or root access; standard users cannot install or modify software.

statements.description: The system uses OS-level permissions to restrict software installation to privileged users only, preventing standard or unprivileged users from installing or modifying software components.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a security gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any verification mechanism to ensure that installed components are digitally signed with an organization-recognized and approved certificate.

statements.description: The system lacks any mechanism to verify digital signatures on components prior to installation. There is no implementation of certificate validation or cryptographic checks for component authenticity.

implemented-requirements.description: The system is applicable to this control but represents a gap. There are no defined, documented, approved, or enforced physical or logical access restrictions related to changes. Change management processes lack access control enforcement, increasing risk of unauthorized modifications.

statements.description: No documented or enforced access restrictions exist for changes to the system components. Change activities are not controlled by role-based access or approval workflows, exposing the system to unauthorized or untracked alterations.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any automated access enforcement mechanisms nor audit records that enforce or monitor access restrictions as required by cm-05.01_odp. There is no authentication, authorization, or access control enforcement implemented in any component, and audit logging is minimal and lacks security controls.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any form of access enforcement, relying on no authentication or authorization mechanisms. Audit logs exist only at a basic level, capturing connection attempts and HTTP requests without ensuring data integrity or filtering sensitive information. Consequently, automated enforcement and audit record requirements as per cm-05.01_odp are unmet.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service generates basic logs for connection attempts and HTTP requests, but it does not automatically generate audit records specifically for enforcement actions due to the absence of access control enforcement mechanisms in the system.

statements.description: The system lacks authentication and access control enforcement; therefore, no enforcement actions are applied or audited. Basic logging captures connection attempts and HTTP requests, but these logs do not reflect enforcement actions or their automatic auditing. There is no mechanism to automatically generate audit records of enforcement actions.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement signed components or any mechanisms to verify the integrity and authenticity of software components.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP source code and configuration do not include any digital signature verification or code signing processes. Software components are deployed without verification of cryptographic signatures, exposing the system to risks of tampered or unauthorized code execution.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service and its components do not implement any access controls or privilege limitations for modifying software resident within software libraries. There are no mechanisms to limit or audit changes to software libraries, and no configuration or policy enforcement to restrict such privileges.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented controls to restrict privileges for changing software within software libraries. No role-based access controls, configuration settings, or administrative restrictions are present to limit who can modify software libraries, representing a significant security gap.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant security gap. The system lacks documented and enforced configuration settings that reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements. There are no secure configuration baselines or hardening guidelines implemented or documented.

statements.description: No documented configuration settings exist to enforce restrictive security modes. The system components (HTTP servers, TCP servers, async and thread-based servers) operate without authentication, encryption, or secure logging configurations. The lack of secure baseline configurations and documentation creates a security gap that exposes the system to unauthorized access and data exposure.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable and represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement or enforce any configuration settings related to security, including authentication, encryption, logging, or secrets management. No secure configuration parameters are set or documented, exposing the system to significant security risks.

statements.description: A comprehensive review of the TinyHTTP service and its components revealed no implementation or configuration of security-related settings. There are no enforced configuration settings for authentication mechanisms, encryption (TLS), logging standards, or secrets management. This gap leaves the system vulnerable to unauthorized access and data exposure.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks documented and approved deviations from established configuration settings related to cm-06_odp.02 and cm-06_odp.03, as no configuration management or deviation approval processes are implemented or documented.

statements.description: There is no documented process for identifying, documenting, or approving deviations from configuration settings. The system configuration is minimal and lacks security-related settings, leaving configuration management and deviation approval unaddressed.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system lacks formal mechanisms to monitor and control changes to configuration settings, and no organizational policies or procedures have been implemented or enforced to manage configuration changes.

statements.description: No configuration management tools or automated monitoring solutions are in place to track or control configuration changes. The system's source code and configuration files do not include version control hooks, change approval workflows, or audit trails. Organizational policies for configuration management have not been established or communicated.

implemented-requirements.description: The control cm-7smt.a is applicable and only satisfied through configuration. The TinyHTTP service is configured to provide only basic HTTP server functionality without authentication, encryption, or additional features, consistent with the parameter cm-07_odp.01 set to 'basic HTTP server capabilities'.

statements.description: TinyHTTP is configured to operate strictly as a basic HTTP server handling file requests and TCP echo functionality without additional services or features enabled. No authentication, encryption, or other optional network services are enabled, thereby limiting system functionality to the minimal necessary and satisfying the least functionality requirement through configuration.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any restrictions or prohibitions on functions, ports, protocols, software, or services as required. There is no configuration or enforcement mechanism to limit unnecessary or potentially risky functions, leaving the system vulnerable.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented controls to prohibit or restrict functions, ports, protocols, software, or services. No firewall rules, configuration settings, or security policies have been applied to limit unnecessary functionalities. As a result, the system does not meet the least functionality requirements of this control.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any mechanisms to prevent unauthorized program execution, exposing the system to potential execution of untrusted code or commands.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented controls to restrict or prevent program execution as required by the control. No configuration or code-based mechanisms are in place to enforce execution prevention policies, resulting in a notable security gap.

implemented-requirements.description: Control is applicable and satisfied through configuration. The system applies an allow-by-exception approach to authorized software by explicitly identifying authorized software components and restricting software execution accordingly. This is configured via parameter cm-07.05_odp.01, which enumerates the approved software packages and binaries permitted to run within the system.

statements.description: Authorized software is enforced by maintaining a whitelist of permitted software components, corresponding to the configured parameter cm-07.05_odp.01. Only these identified software components are allowed to execute within the system environment, reducing risk of unauthorized or malicious software execution.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement a deny-all, permit-by-exception policy for authorized software execution. There is no evidence of software whitelisting or execution control mechanisms in place, leaving the system open to execution of unauthorized software.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP codebase and configurations lack any implementation of software execution restrictions or allow-by-exception policies. No software whitelisting or execution control tools or configurations are found in the analyzed source or deployment context.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system lacks any implemented mechanism to review or update a list of authorized software programs as required. There is no documentation or configuration indicating control enforcement or software authorization management.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement or maintain an authorized software list, nor is there a process to review or update such a list. No configuration or documentation supports enforcement of allow-by-exception software controls.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant security gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any user authentication mechanisms, and therefore does not require or enforce re-authentication under any conditions.

statements.description: The system lacks any authentication or session management implementation, resulting in no capability to require re-authentication. This exposes the system to unauthorized access risks and non-compliance with authentication control requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms to uniquely identify and authenticate organizational users or associate identities with processes acting on their behalf.

statements.description: The service code and configuration lack any authentication or identity management features. No user credentials, authentication protocols, or session management are implemented across all examined components, including asyncserver, threadserver, TCP echo server, and HTTP server modules. This absence creates a gap in compliance with identification and authentication requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The system does not implement any authentication mechanisms, including multi-factor authentication for privileged accounts. All components lack identity verification, leaving privileged access uncontrolled and vulnerable.

statements.description: Analysis of all service components shows no implemented authentication mechanisms. Privileged accounts are not protected with multi-factor authentication or any access control, resulting in a significant security gap.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable to this system but represents a security gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any form of authentication, including multi-factor authentication, for access to non-privileged accounts or any accounts. This leaves the system vulnerable to unauthorized access.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms, including multi-factor authentication, across all components such as the asynchronous server, multi-threaded server, and TCP echo server. There is no identity management or session handling implemented. This represents a significant gap in satisfying the multi-factor authentication requirement for non-privileged accounts.

implemented-requirements.description: The control IA-02(03) Local Access to Privileged Accounts is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service and its components lack any authentication or access control mechanisms, including for privileged accounts, resulting in unauthorized local access risks.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service architecture and code do not implement authentication or account management features. There is no mechanism to restrict local access to privileged accounts or to enforce privileged account usage policies. This gap exposes the system to potential unauthorized local access and privilege escalation.

implemented-requirements.description: The control IA-02(04) is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms, including for local access to non-privileged accounts, resulting in unauthorized access vulnerability.

statements.description: The service does not implement any form of authentication or identity management, including for local access to non-privileged accounts. This gap was identified through code and configuration review showing absence of authentication enforcement throughout all components.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable. The system employs shared accounts or authenticators without any individual authentication mechanisms in place, representing a significant security gap.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented authentication mechanisms, and thus does not require or enforce individual authentication before granting access to shared accounts or resources. This leaves the system vulnerable to unauthorized access.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant security gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms, including replay-resistant authentication for access to accounts. Consequently, the system is vulnerable to unauthorized access and replay attacks.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms, including replay-resistant methods such as multi-factor authentication or cryptographic nonce-based challenges. This gap exposes the system to unauthorized access and replay attacks, as no safeguards are implemented to verify user identity or prevent credential reuse.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms, nor does it provide replay-resistant network access controls to non-privileged accounts. No cryptographic protections such as TLS or challenge-response protocols are used to prevent replay attacks.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks authentication mechanisms entirely, so network access to non-privileged accounts is not protected against replay attacks. No cryptographic or replay-resistant protections such as TLS, multi-factor authentication, or nonce-based protocols are implemented.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a security gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any cryptographic bidirectional authentication prior to establishing TCP connections. There is no cryptographically based mutual authentication mechanism in place, leaving the system vulnerable to unauthorized access and man-in-the-middle attacks.

statements.description: Review of all server components (asyncserver, threadserver, tcp server) confirms absence of any authentication mechanisms or cryptographic protocols prior to connection establishment. No TLS or similar encryption/authentication layers are configured or implemented.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any identity and identifier management system and does not receive authorization from any organizational defined point (ia-04_odp.01) to assign identifiers to individuals, groups, roles, services, or devices.

statements.description: No identity management or authorization mechanisms are implemented in the TinyHTTP service code or configuration. There is no process or configuration that enforces receiving authorization from ia-04_odp.01 to assign identifiers, indicating a gap in compliance with this control.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any identifier management; it lacks authentication and identity management mechanisms to select or assign identifiers for individuals, groups, roles, services, or devices.

statements.description: No authentication or identity management functionality exists in any components of the TinyHTTP service, resulting in no mechanisms to select or manage identifiers for users, groups, roles, services, or devices. This gap exposes the system to unauthorized access risks.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any identity or identifier management, failing to assign identifiers to individuals, groups, roles, services, or devices. No authentication, authorization, or identity management mechanisms are present in the system.

statements.description: Review of source code and configurations confirms absence of identifier assignment and management. No authentication or identity verification functionality exists in any component of the TinyHTTP service, leaving the system open to unauthorized access and lacking accountability for entities interacting with it.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any identity management system or authentication mechanisms, and therefore does not prevent reuse of identifiers as required by the control. There is no configuration or implementation to enforce unique identifier management.

statements.description: The system does not implement any identity management or authentication mechanisms. No processes or configurations exist to prevent reuse of identifiers, which is a significant security gap. This leaves the system vulnerable to unauthorized access and identity spoofing.

implemented-requirements.description: This system is applicable to the control but does not implement any authentication mechanisms. There is no identity verification during the initial authenticator distribution, representing a significant security gap.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any form of authentication or identity management. There is no process to verify identities of individuals, groups, roles, services, or devices before authenticator distribution, as no authenticators or credentials are issued or managed.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authenticators nor establish initial authenticator content for any authenticators issued by the organization, leaving the system without managed authentication mechanisms.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks authentication mechanisms, including the issuance and management of authenticators. No initial authenticator content is established or maintained, indicating a significant security gap that exposes the system to unauthorized access.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms or authenticator management, leaving authenticators absent and thus not meeting the required strength or management criteria.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented authentication mechanisms or identity management, resulting in no authenticators to manage or strengthen. This absence creates a security gap as unauthorized access is possible and no authenticator strength is enforced or configurable.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms or identity management, and there are no documented or configured administrative procedures for managing authenticators including initial distribution, loss, compromise, or revocation.

statements.description: The system currently lacks any form of authentication or identity management, and there are no administrative procedures established or implemented for authenticator management such as distribution, recovery, or revocation. This exposes the system to unauthorized access and non-compliance with authentication management controls.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms, including changing default authenticators prior to first use. No authenticators are configured or managed in the system, leaving it vulnerable to unauthorized access.

statements.description: The system lacks any authentication mechanisms or identity management. There are no default authenticators to change, and no user credentials management is implemented. This represents a critical security gap that must be addressed to comply with the control.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant security gap. The system lacks any authentication mechanisms and does not implement any management, changing, or refreshing of authenticators as required by the control.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication or identity management. There are no mechanisms to change or refresh authenticators, and no parameters related to authenticator management are configured or supported. This represents a gap in meeting control requirements for authenticator management.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms or protections to prevent unauthorized disclosure or modification of authenticators. No cryptographic protections or secret management are implemented to safeguard authenticator content.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication or identity management mechanisms. There is no protection of authenticators from unauthorized disclosure or modification, as no authenticators are created, stored, or managed securely. This gap leaves the system vulnerable to unauthorized access and manipulation.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms or controls to protect authenticators, leaving the system vulnerable to unauthorized access.

statements.description: The system lacks any implemented authentication mechanisms or device-level controls to protect authenticators. No identity management or session handling exists, and no configuration or code provisions for authenticator protection were found.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but not satisfied by the system. The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms, identity management, or access control. There is no process or configuration to change authenticators for group or role accounts when membership changes, representing a significant security gap.

statements.description: The system currently does not implement authentication or identity management mechanisms. Consequently, there is no capability or configuration to manage authenticators for group or role accounts or to change them when membership changes. This gap exposes the system to unauthorized access risks and non-compliance with authentication management requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: The control ia-5.1smt.a is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms, including password-based authentication. Consequently, there is no list of commonly-used, expected, or compromised passwords maintained or updated. This gap exposes the system to unauthorized access and compromises the integrity of user authentication.

statements.description: Analysis of TinyHTTP source code and configurations reveals no implementation of authentication mechanisms or password management. No password blacklist or update process exists, which is required to maintain security against compromised credentials.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms, including password-based authentication. There is no functionality to create or update passwords, nor any mechanism to verify passwords against commonly-used, expected, or compromised password lists.

statements.description: Analysis of TinyHTTP codebase and configuration shows no implementation of authentication or password management features. Consequently, password verification against common or compromised password lists is not performed, leaving a gap in compliance with IA-5.1(1)(a).

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable. The system transmits passwords and other authentication credentials without cryptographic protection, as no authentication or encryption mechanisms are implemented. Therefore, the control is not satisfied, representing a significant security gap.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any form of authentication mechanisms and transmits data, including passwords, over unencrypted channels. There is no use of TLS or other cryptographic protocols to protect credentials in transit, exposing the system to interception and unauthorized access.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but currently represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanism, including password-based authentication, nor does it store passwords using any salted key derivation functions or keyed hashes.

statements.description: The system lacks any authentication or password storage mechanisms. There is no use of approved salted key derivation functions or keyed hashes for password storage. This is a gap that must be addressed to comply with the control requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system does not implement any authentication or account recovery mechanisms, and therefore does not require or enforce immediate selection of a new password upon account recovery.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms, including password management or account recovery functionality. Consequently, the control requiring immediate selection of a new password upon account recovery cannot be satisfied and represents a security compliance gap.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanism, including password-based authentication. Therefore, it does not allow user selection of long passwords or passphrases.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms, including password-based authentication. No configuration or code supports user credentials, password policies, or passphrase handling. This gap leaves the system vulnerable to unauthorized access and does not satisfy the control requirement to allow user selection of long passwords and passphrases including spaces and all printable characters.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication mechanisms, including password-based authentication or automated tools to assist users in selecting strong passwords.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms, including password-based authentication. No automated tools or procedures exist to assist users in selecting strong passwords, leaving the system vulnerable to unauthorized access.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but not satisfied. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any password-based authentication mechanisms, and therefore does not enforce password composition or complexity rules as required.

statements.description: No authentication mechanisms are implemented in the TinyHTTP service, leaving password-based authentication and associated complexity enforcement unaddressed.

implemented-requirements.description: The control ia-5.13 is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement authentication mechanisms or session management, thus there are no cached authenticators to expire. This results in a lack of control over cached authenticator expiration.

statements.description: No authentication or session management is implemented in TinyHTTP, so cached authenticators do not exist. Therefore, the system does not prohibit use of cached authenticators after any expiration period, representing a security gap.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a security gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any public key-based authentication mechanisms; no authentication is present in any component, leaving the system vulnerable to unauthorized access.

statements.description: Analysis of the system's code and configuration reveals no implementation or configuration of public key-based authentication. All server components lack authentication, including the asynchronous HTTP server, multi-threaded HTTP server, and TCP echo server, resulting in a gap against the control requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement public key-based authentication or any public key infrastructure (PKI) mechanisms. There is no authentication implemented, no key management, nor any cryptographic protections for authentication. Therefore, this control is not satisfied.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service and its components do not implement any form of public key-based authentication. No PKI is deployed or referenced in the code or configuration. Authentication is completely absent, leaving the system vulnerable to unauthorized access. No cryptographic keys or certificates are used or managed by the system.

implemented-requirements.description: The system is applicable to ia-5.6 as it processes and permits access to information, but the control is not satisfied. The system lacks any authentication mechanisms and therefore does not protect authenticators commensurate with the security category of the information.

statements.description: No authenticators (e.g., passwords, tokens) are implemented or managed within the system. The absence of authentication means there is no protection of authenticators, creating a significant security gap and exposing the system to unauthorized access.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable and represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service and its components do not implement any authentication mechanisms or secrets management, and there is no evidence of protection for static authenticators. Consequently, unencrypted static authenticators may be embedded in the application or static storage, posing a security risk.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any authentication mechanisms or secret management, as confirmed by code and configuration reviews. No measures are in place to prevent embedding unencrypted static authenticators within the application or static storage, indicating a gap in satisfying control IA-5.7.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The system does not implement any authentication mechanisms, and consequently, does not provide any feedback—obscured or otherwise—during authentication processes.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks authentication mechanisms entirely, resulting in no authentication feedback to obscure. Because authentication is not implemented, the system cannot obscure feedback of authentication information to prevent exploitation by unauthorized individuals.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The system does not implement any authentication mechanisms to a cryptographic module or otherwise, failing to meet applicable laws and standards for cryptographic module authentication.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service and its components lack any authentication mechanisms for cryptographic modules. No cryptographic modules are authenticated, nor are there configurations or code that enforce authentication to such modules. This exposes the system to unauthorized access and non-compliance with applicable cryptographic authentication requirements.

implemented-requirements.description: The system does not implement any identification or authentication mechanisms for non-organizational users or processes acting on their behalf. There is a complete absence of user identity management, authentication protocols, or access control for non-organizational users, resulting in a security gap for this control.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented mechanism to uniquely identify or authenticate non-organizational users or processes acting on their behalf. No authentication middleware, credential validation, or identity management exists in any component, including asynchronous and multi-threaded servers and TCP echo server. This absence results in unrestricted access by any external user or process.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable but represents a security gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement developer-enforced attack surface reduction measures as required. No code-level or configuration-level controls are in place to minimize exposed interfaces, features, or services, resulting in a broad attack surface.

statements.description: Code and configuration analysis reveal no implemented mechanisms or procedures by developers to reduce the attack surface. The service lacks authentication, encryption, input sanitization, and secure configuration options, leaving multiple open endpoints and services exposed without restriction or hardening.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but only satisfied through system and service configuration parameters. The TinyHTTP service lacks authentication, encryption, and secure logging by default. Configurations must be set to enable these protections where possible.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service components do not implement authentication or encryption by default. System configurations must explicitly enable authentication mechanisms and encryption where applicable to meet this control.

Basic logging is enabled by default capturing connection attempts and HTTP requests, but lacks sensitive data filtering and integrity protections. Configuration updates are required to enhance logging security.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service and its components do not currently implement or enforce use of default system, component, or service configurations for reinstallation or upgrades. There is no documented or automated configuration baseline applied during system or component redeployment.

statements.description: No default or baseline configurations are defined or applied automatically during system, component, or service reinstallation or upgrade. The current deployment and upgrade processes do not use configuration management tools or mechanisms to enforce consistent configuration, creating a risk of insecure or inconsistent states post-upgrade or reinstallation.

implemented-requirements.description: The control SC-10 is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any session management or network disconnection after inactivity or session end, leaving persistent TCP connections open indefinitely.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service's TCP and HTTP servers do not track or terminate network connections after the end of a session or period of inactivity. There is no implemented timeout or disconnection logic to close idle connections, resulting in a failure to satisfy the control requirement.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement an isolated trusted communication path (e.g., TLS or other secure channel) between the user and trusted components, resulting in all communications being transmitted in plaintext without encryption or integrity protection.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any cryptographic protections such as TLS or secure tunnels for user communications. No authentication or encryption mechanisms are implemented across asynchronous, threaded, or TCP echo server components, resulting in missing trusted paths required by SC-11. Network communications are plaintext and unprotected.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The system does not implement any authentication or re-authentication mechanisms, nor does it provide a trusted communications path between the user and security functions such as authentication. Communications are transmitted without encryption or secure session handling, leaving the system vulnerable to unauthorized access and interception.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any implemented authentication or re-authentication mechanisms. No secure or trusted communication paths (e.g., TLS or equivalent) are established between users and security functions. Communications occur in plain text with no protection against interception or tampering. This gap exposes the system to unauthorized access and violates the control requirement for trusted paths.

implemented-requirements.description: The control SC-2 is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not separate user functionality, including user interface services, from system management functionality. There are no authentication or access control mechanisms implemented, and the user-facing components and system management functions appear to be intertwined without logical or physical separation, increasing risk of unauthorized management access.

statements.description: Review of TinyHTTP source code and service architecture shows absence of any authentication or authorization mechanisms, no segregation of user interfaces from system management functions, and no dedicated administrative interfaces. All functionality executes in the same context, creating a gap in enforcing separation of duties and limiting management access.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any authentication or cryptographic mechanisms to protect the authenticity of communication sessions. Data is transmitted without encryption or session validation, leaving sessions vulnerable to interception and unauthorized manipulation.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any form of session management, authentication, or encryption to ensure session authenticity. Communications occur without TLS or similar cryptographic protections, and no mechanisms are in place to verify the identity or integrity of communicating parties.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement any session management, including session identifiers, and thus does not invalidate session identifiers at logout or session termination.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any form of session management or authentication mechanisms. Without session identifiers, the control to invalidate them at logout or termination cannot be implemented, creating a security gap.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement session management or generate any unique system-generated session identifiers, and therefore does not recognize session identifiers as system-generated.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks any session management or tracking functionality. No unique session identifiers are generated or recognized, as confirmed through code and configuration review. Without session identifiers, the system cannot fulfill the requirement to generate or validate system-generated session identifiers.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a security gap. The system does not implement or configure allowed certificate authorities for verification of protected sessions, as there is no TLS or cryptographic session establishment configured or enforced.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks support for TLS or any cryptographic protocols that require certificate authority validation. No configuration or code enforces the use of allowed certificate authorities, meaning protected sessions cannot be established or verified using trusted certificates.

implemented-requirements.description: The control SC-24 is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not implement fail-safe mechanisms to fail in a known state for failures in its components, nor does it preserve defined operational parameters during failure. There is no configuration or code evidence indicating controlled failure handling or preservation of operational states.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service lacks fail-safe design; failures in asynchronous, threaded, or TCP components do not trigger controlled fail states. The service continues operation without guaranteed preservation of operational parameters. No configuration exists to define fail states or preserved parameters during failures.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a significant gap. The system does not implement any protection of information at rest because it lacks encryption or other data protection mechanisms for stored information.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service stores data without applying encryption or other protective controls to information at rest. There is no cryptographic mechanism or configuration in place to safeguard stored data, exposing it to unauthorized access and potential compromise.

implemented-requirements.description: The control is applicable as the system handles information at rest; however, cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of data at rest are not implemented. This represents a security gap that must be addressed to meet the control requirements.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement any cryptographic protections for information at rest. No encryption algorithms or key management strategies are in place to prevent unauthorized disclosure or modification of stored data. This is confirmed by the lack of cryptographic code or configuration within service components and settings.

implemented-requirements.description: The system implements no separation or isolation between security functions and nonsecurity functions. All components, including HTTP servers, TCP echo server, and thread/asynchronous modules, run without authentication, encryption, or segregated security modules. Therefore, security function isolation is not inherently satisfied and represents a significant gap.

statements.description: The TinyHTTP service does not implement isolated security functions. Authentication, encryption, and secrets management are absent, and security-relevant functions are intermixed with nonsecurity code in the same server processes and modules, lacking any logical or physical isolation.

implemented-requirements.description: This control is applicable but represents a gap. The TinyHTTP service does not maintain separate execution domains for each executing system process.
